numbered_ace_sentences: 1. More women reach out to a parent than men.
2. Men and women prefer to send texts than to visit a parent in person.
3. Men and women prefer to phone or video-chat than to visit a parent in person.
4. I wonder why more women than men reach out to a parent.
5. I wonder how the ages in the graph affect the data.
6. I wonder how the lives of the surveyed people affect the data.
7. Some surveyed people have a good relationship with a parent.
8. Some surveyed people do not have a good relationship with a parent.
9. This relates to me and my community.
10. It is important that a person reaches out to a parent semi-often.
11. This is important if the person has a good relationship with the parent.
12. A parent usually needs this contact.
13. The headline is: Parents Were Right: The Phone Does Work Both Ways.
